title: Middle East respiratory syndrome
summary: Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS), also known as camel flu,[1] is a viral respiratory infection caused by Middle East respiratory syndromeâ€“related coronavirus (MERS-CoV).[2] Symptoms may range from none, to mild, to severe.[7][2] Typical symptoms include fever, cough, diarrhea, and shortness of breath.[2] The disease is typically more severe in those with other health problems.[2][7]
